item.title: Singleton Design Pattern - When Not to Use It
item.description: The Singleton design pattern is one of the simplest yet most powerful design patterns in software development. It ensures that a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to that instance. Let’s explore its implementation in C# and discuss scenarios where it is appropriate to use this pattern and when it is better to avoid it. **ðŸ“¢**Table of Contents Singleton Design Pattern When to Use the Singleton Pattern When Not to Use the Singleton Pattern **ðŸ§¾**Singleton Design Pattern The Singleton pattern restricts the instantiation of a class to one single instance.

item.title: Understanding the Monad Design Pattern
item.description: Monads are a powerful concept in functional programming that help manage side effects and maintain clean, composable code. In this post, we’ll explore the Maybe monad design pattern using JavaScript, which is used to handle operations that might fail or return null/undefined. What is a Monad? In simple terms, a monad is a design pattern that allows you to wrap values, chain operations, and handle side effects in a consistent way.
